newsitem.title: GERMANY: BASF CFO sees share buyback as early as 98.
newsitem.headline: BASF CFO sees share buyback as early as 98.

text.p: German chemicals group BASF AG said on Wednesday it hoped to take the chance to buy back some of its own shares as early as 1998.
Chief financial officer Max Dietrich Kley told Reuters that he expected a law allowing share buybacks to come into force in the coming year.
"We are quite happy with the progress that has been made in Bonn. I think we will see the law in force next year. We will try to bring this matter to our shareholders' assembly in 1998," Kley said.
Kley added that the number of shares BASF would buy back depended both on the wording of the law and the amount of funds available to finance the transaction.
